verses.kjv: Man that is born of a woman is of few days, and full of trouble.
verses.ct: Every person born of a woman lives only a short time, and that time is filled with trouble.

verses.kjv: He cometh forth like a flower, and is cut down: he fleeth also as a shadow, and continueth not.
verses.ct: We spring up like a flower and then wither away. We vanish like a shadow and don't last.

verses.kjv: And dost thou open thine eyes upon such an one, and bringest me into judgment with thee?
verses.ct: Do you really fix your attention on someone like this and drag me before you for judgment?

verses.kjv: Who can bring a clean thing out of an unclean? not one.
verses.ct: Who can produce something pure from what is impure? No one can.

verses.kjv: Seeing his days are determined, the number of his months are with thee, thou hast appointed his bounds that he cannot pass;
verses.ct: Since a person's lifespan is already decided, and you have set the number of his months, and you have established limits he cannot go beyond —

verses.kjv: Turn from him, that he may rest, till he shall accomplish, as an hireling, his day.
verses.ct: look away from him so he can have some rest, until he finishes his day's work like a hired laborer.

verses.kjv: For there is hope of a tree, if it be cut down, that it will sprout again, and that the tender branch thereof will not cease.
verses.ct: At least a tree has hope — if it gets chopped down, it can sprout again, and its new shoots won't stop growing.

verses.kjv: Though the root thereof wax old in the earth, and the stock thereof die in the ground;
verses.ct: Even if its roots grow old in the ground and its stump dies in the dirt,

verses.kjv: Yet through the scent of water it will bud, and bring forth boughs like a plant.
verses.ct: at the first hint of water it will bud and put out branches like a young plant.

verses.kjv: But man dieth, and wasteth away: yea, man giveth up the ghost, and where is he?
verses.ct: But when a person dies, his strength fades away. When someone takes his last breath, where does he go?

verses.kjv: As the waters fail from the sea, and the flood decayeth and drieth up:
verses.ct: Just as water evaporates from a lake and a river shrinks and dries up,

verses.kjv: So man lieth down, and riseth not: till the heavens be no more, they shall not awake, nor be raised out of their sleep.
verses.ct: so a person lies down and does not get up again. Until the heavens no longer exist, they will not wake or be roused from their sleep.

verses.kjv: O that thou wouldest hide me in the grave, that thou wouldest keep me secret, until thy wrath be past, that thou wouldest appoint me a set time, and remember me!
verses.ct: If only you would hide me in the grave and conceal me until your anger passes! If only you would set a specific time and then remember me!

verses.kjv: If a man die, shall he live again? all the days of my appointed time will I wait, till my change come.
verses.ct: If a person dies, will he live again? I would wait through all the days of my hard service until my release finally comes.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt call, and I will answer thee: thou wilt have a desire to the work of thine hands.
verses.ct: You would call out, and I would answer you. You would long for the creature your hands have made.

verses.kjv: For now thou numberest my steps: dost thou not watch over my sin?
verses.ct: But right now you count my every step. Aren't you keeping track of my sin?

verses.kjv: My transgression is sealed up in a bag, and thou sewest up mine iniquity.
verses.ct: My wrongdoing is sealed in a pouch, and you have stitched up my guilt to preserve it.

verses.kjv: And surely the mountain falling cometh to nought, and the rock is removed out of his place.
verses.ct: Yet even mountains eventually crumble and fall, and boulders get shifted from their place.

verses.kjv: The waters wear the stones: thou washest away the things which grow out of the dust of the earth; and thou destroyest the hope of man.
verses.ct: Water wears down stones, and floods wash away the soil of the earth — and in the same way, you destroy a person's hope.

verses.kjv: Thou prevailest for ever against him, and he passeth: thou changest his countenance, and sendest him away.
verses.ct: You overpower him permanently, and he is gone. You change his appearance and send him away.

verses.kjv: His sons come to honour, and he knoweth it not; and they are brought low, but he perceiveth it not of them.
verses.ct: His children may rise to honor, but he never knows it. They may fall into disgrace, but he is unaware of it.

verses.kjv: But his flesh upon him shall have pain, and his soul within him shall mourn.
verses.ct: He only feels the pain in his own body, and his soul grieves only for himself.
